Sequence Information.Source: screen from wild progenitor of bread wheat,Aegilops tauschii, plant-derived, natural derivatives

Literature.Author: Fu T, Islam MS, Ali M, Wu J, Dong W. 2020
Literature.Title: Two antimicrobial genes from Aegilops tauschii Cosson identified by the Bacillus subtilis expression system

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (33.3%) toMastoparan-VT7I=N: 14%, GRAVY: 0.15; M Wt: 2432.771; M formula: C106H165N27O32S2; mol ex coeff: 3105.Discovery:  inhibition of bacterial growth due to AMP gene expressionActivity: active against Gram+ B.subtilis IA274 (- insignificant), C. michiganensis (+++), B.cereus 905 (-), C. fangii (+++), B. subtilis 330-2 (+),  B.subtilis RIK1285 (-), B. subtilis 168 (+++), Gram- X. oryzae pv. Oryzae (-), X. oryzae pv. Oryzicola (+++), R. solanacearum (+), X. campestris pv. Holcicola (-). Bacteriostatic.Antimicrobial robustness: slight decrease in activity with the increase in temperature >60oCToxicity: human RBC, 2.09% hemolysis at 1000 ug/ml (not hemo.lytic)Recombinant production:bacteria:Bacillus subtilis: the engineered liquid fermentation products were spray dried to power.plant treatment:tomato: The diluted solution of the fermented powder exerted an antimicrobial action by secreting antimicrobial protein.  AMP-containing filter paper (placed on tomato leaves) had good inhibitory effects and reduced fruit rot infected with B. cinerea compared to the control (empty vector).
